title: Pellegrini 2013 Olivet Lane Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Young and tightly wound, this wine from the family's Olivet Lane Vineyard is reduced and generous in oak and spicy dark cherry, its aromas resplendent in rose petal. Layered and soft, it's big on complexity and plush textures, with a lengthy, caramel-and cola-laced finish.

title: Quivira 2012 Elusive G-S-M (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This blend of 65% Grenache, 20% Syrah and 15% Mourvèdre needs more time to develop. In its youth it's shy to reveal much beyond a robust, earthy and tannic taste of inky black fruit and tobacco. Let open further or set this wine down through early 2017 or so.

title: Proulx 2012 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Cherry-raspberry notes show on the nose of this appellation blend from a Paso producer, along with eucalyptus and cedar. The palate is straightforward, with cranberry, raspberry, pencil lead and a bit of tar.

title: Pulchella 2013 Witness Red (Paso Robles)
description: Ripe black cherry, black plum and chipped slate aromas greet the nose on this blend of 86% Grenache from La Vista Vineyard and 14% Petite Sirah from Mainini Vineyard. It's soft and ripe with blackberry fruit at first sip, then comes an electrifying acidity and flavors of roasted fennel and pencil lead.

title: Vie Winery 2012 L'Intruse Mourvèdre (Santa Barbara County)
description: Fairly shy aromas of boysenberry pie and pencil lead eventually waft to the nose on this bottling from a winery in San Francisco. Light berry flavors are enhanced with a plum-skin grip as elderflower and rose petal notes emerge through the sip.

title: Testarossa 2013 Graham Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a generous, tightly wound vineyard-designate that tastes more full-figured than it lists in terms of alcohol, jammy in dark plum and cardamom. It finishes with a ripe robustness of dark cherry fruit flavor and hint of earth.

title: The Girls in the Vineyard 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Hills Lake County)
description: This is a full-bodied and moderately tannic wine, smelling smoky, minty and fruity. It tastes concentrated and feels firm and nicely tannic on the tongue. Not overly ripe, it doesn't scream for attention but will make a really nice bottle for dinner.

title: The Winery SF 2013 Pinot Noir (North Coast)
description: This medium-bodied wine has aromas and flavors like baking spices and red cherries, a firm, dry texture, and lots of appeal as a mealtime wine. It is well balanced and tasty, but not over the top.

title: Tin Barn 2013 Gilsson Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: From a vineyard planted in 1950, this wine is rich in ripe cherry and vanilla, with a full-bodied, jammy smoothness that makes it pleasant to drink. From the warmer side of the appellation, it is concentrated and structured through the meaty, peppery finish.

title: Trece Ranchos 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: This is a shockingly low price for anything from Rutherford, let alone Cabernet Sauvignon, but sometimes why ask why? Dusty and powerful, it's well balanced in acidity and black fruit, finishing in leather and dark chocolate bound by leather.

title: Trefethen 2012 Dragon's Tooth Red (Napa Valley)
description: From the cool reaches of Oak Knoll, this blends 66% Malbec, 20% Petit Verdot and 14% Cabernet Sauvignon. Aged in French, Hungarian and American oak, it offers grippy layers of brooding blackberry and blueberry, seasoned in cinnamon and dried herb.

title: Treleaven 2012 Vintner's Cuvée Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
description: Crisp lime acidity counters a sunny, lemon-cream disposition in this lusciously composed Chardonnay. The palate is silky in texture, lingering long and luxuriously on the finish.

title: Sauska 2011 Kékfrankos (Villány)
description: Deep ruby in the glass, this wine offers aromas of cherry cola, espresso and black cherry. Black plum flavors are enhanced by a medley of spice including cinnamon, clove and nutmeg. A strong network of tannins lingers on the palate into the persistent finish. Called Kekfrankos in Hungary, this grape is more commonly known as Blaufränkisch.

title: Sbragia 2012 Gino's Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Made from a majority of Zinfandel with tiny amounts of Carignane and Petite Sirah, Gino's is big, rich and straightforward, with a touch of dried herb and dark plum surrounded by accents of oak. Powerfully robust, it'll need a rich meat dish to stand alongside.

title: Seifried 2014 Old Coach Road Pinot Gris (Nelson)
description: Pear, peach and cinnamon notes all mingle easily on the nose of this medium-bodied, barely pink-tinged wine. On the palate, the fruit takes charge, leaving it easy to drink alone, or with simple fish or chicken dishes.

title: Sequoia Grove 2012 Malbec (Napa Valley)
description: Brawny, with a bite, this wine offers juicy blackberry and black cherry, along with Cab-like elements of clove that give spiciness. Medium bodied and well integrated, it was aged entirely in neutral oak, allowing the fruit to shine.

title: Oberon 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: A healthy percentage of Sauvignon Musque sets the tone for this creamy and somewhat spicy white wine, a mix of vanilla and unctuous fig that finds a balance with flavors of crisp, green apple and melon. Fresh acidity keeps the fullness of the wine in check.

title: Oliver 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (America)
description: Iconic Sauvignon Blanc notes of pink grapefruit, gooseberry, mango and papaya shine brightly on the nose and palate. Ample weight, with balanced acidity and crisp, clean flavors mark this well-made wine at a bargain price.

title: Wolfberger 2014 Signature Riesling (Alsace)
description: Fruity notions of apple juice and fresh apple peel are signalled on the nose. The palate follows more softly than expected and shows a balanced, textured dryness in this very clean, almost taut Riesling.

title: Château Beaulieu 2014 Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: This is a deliciously refreshing wine. It's acidity and red-currant fruits are bright, crisp and right up front. The rounder, caramel and spice backdrop to all this fruitiness makes it just right for the table.

title: Gérard Bertrand 2013 Grand Terroir Syrah-Carignan-Mourvèdre Red (La Clape)
description: This ripe, easydrinking blend of 50% Syrah, 35% Carignan and 15% Mourvèdre opens with aromas of mocha, raspberry, herbed cherry and purple flowers. The structure is attractive and approachable, with soft tannins and final flavors of muddled cherry, raspberry sauce and fudgy brownie.

title: Hecht & Bannier 2014 Vermentino (Côtes de Provence)
description: Produced from vineyards in the mountains away from the coast, this cool wine still gives free rein to the richness of Vermentino. There is an herbal touch, some spice and ripe apricot flavors. Balanced and fruity now, it will be better from 2016.

title: Kuentz-Bas 2014 Tradition Pinot Gris (Alsace)
description: Very ripe pear fruit is dangerously close to tipping over into cloying richness, almost hinting at cream soda. The palate is less overwhelming. As always, that special streak of Alsace acid saves the day.

title: Kunde 2014 Magnolia Lane Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)
description: This estate-grown white is consistently yummy, tangy in lemon peel and fresh-squeezed lemon, with a splash of fresh grapefruit. Dry and crisp, it finishes refreshingly, an ideal wine for light appetizers and most rewardingly, raw oysters.

title: La Cappuccina 2013  Soave
description: Aromas of honeysuckle and orchard fruit lead the nose. The fruity palate doles out white peach, green apple and a hint of white almond alongside lively acidity. A mineral note signals the close.

title: La Vis 2011 Ritratti Cabernet Sauvignon (Trentino)
description: Aromas of cassis, Alpine herbs and a whiff of menthol lead the nose. The straightforward palate offers dried black cherry, redcurrant, espresso and ground black pepper alongside firm but refined tannins. Drink through 2016.

title: Tres Palacios 2011 Cholqui Merlot (Maipo Valley)
description: Damp, earthy aromas are a bit murky and leafy. On the palate, this Merlot is high in acid and almost shearing. Back on the flavor profile, it's salty, herbal and pruny. Lasting acidity on the finish keeps this lively; drink through 2017.

title: Trump 2014 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Monticello)
description: Fragrant aromas of green pear and apple mix with a riper peach note on the nose. With 10% aged in French oak, this Chardonnay trends toward the unoaked style—light bodied, crisp and fruit-forward. The streamlined, citrusy palate takes on a crunchy pear flavor, lightly dusted with talc.

title: Concha y Toro 2013 Casillero del Diablo Reserva Privada Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: Plum and blackberry aromas are mildly grassy and horsey. On the palate, this Cabernet is bold, fleshy and tannic in feel, with a solid structure. Blackberry and oak flavors are a touch green and spicy, while this finishes with spicy, herbal notes.

title: De Faveri 2014 Millesimato Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)
description: Aromas of jasmine, green apple and a whiff of exotic fruit lead the nose and follow through to the vibrant palate, along with ripe pear and juicy white peach. A foaming, vivacious mousse accents the rich fruit flavors.
